items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: IndiGo, IndusInd Bank, Colgate, NALCO, Hindustan Zinc, NBCC, Aarti Industries, Birlasoft, MGL, Oil India in focus on 22 May
items.description: Stocks to Watch, 22 May: Stocks like NBCC (India), Jindal Poly Films,Hindustan Zinc,Data Patterns (India), Zinka Logistics Solutions, KPR Mill, Aarti Industries, Birlasoft, Hindustan Copper, Mahanagar Gas, Piramal Enterprises, InterGlobe Aviation, IndusInd Bank, Colgate Palmolive (India), National Aluminium Company, and Oil India will be in focus on May 22.

items.title: Whirlpool puts up a decent show amid parent’s stake sale overhang
items.description: Promoter Whirlpool Corp plans to lower its stake in Whirlpool India to 20 percent this year

items.title: Indigo — Will the airline’s performance continue to fly high?
items.description: Increased cancellations due to geopolitical tension likely to impact yields in Q1 FY26

items.title: Agri Picks Report May 22, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The sowing of summer crops in Maharashtra reached 510,539 hectares as of Monday, up 20% on year from 424,345 hectares sown in the same period last year, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Repco Home Finance: Sustained loan growth to drive re-rating
items.description: Loan growth, asset quality improvement on the cards

items.title: Is Cantabil the next retail growth story?
items.description: At 18x FY27E earnings, CRIL offers an attractive valuation with strong operating leverage and improving demand visibility

items.title: GRSE shares up over 3 percent after emerging as L1 bidder for Rs 25,000 crore contract for Naval warships
items.description: GRSE had attended the Commercial Negotiation Committee (CNC) meeting convened by the Defence Ministry for eight Next Generation Corvettes (NGC) on May 21.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on May 22
items.description: Sensex tumbled over 664 points to close at 80,952, while the Nifty 50 index dropped 0.82% to end the session at 24,609.7.

items.title: India-US bond yield spread narrows, prompting Uday Kotak to wonder if a historic flip is coming
items.description: The spread between the two benchmark yields has fallen to a more-than-two-decade low, driven largely by a spike in US yields.

items.title: Live: Sensex, Nifty decline nearly 1% amid broad-based selloff | Closing Bell
items.description: Markets tumble as rising bond yields spark a global risk-off. Sensex & Nifty fall nearly 1%. IT stocks lead the rout on US deficit concerns. Catch Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they decode the carnage and spotlight key movers like IndusInd Bank and Bajaj Auto.

items.title: Defence stocks on fire, led by GRSE and other shipyards, defying valuation worries
items.description: In recent days, defence shares have seen significant volatility after a record run following Operation Sindoor. Despite strong tailwinds, analysts are flagging frothy valuations in the share of defence suppliers.

items.title: Nifty down less than a percent near 24,600 on expiry swings, sharp selloff and late rebound seen amid US yield spike
items.description: Broader markets also remained under pressure, albeit off lows, with the Midcap 100 and Smallcap 100 slipping 0.52 percent and 0.26 percent, respectively.

items.title: Buy Embassy Office Parks REIT; target of Rs 425: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services is bullish on Embassy Office Parks REIT has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 425 in its research report dated May 22, 2025.

items.title: India’s defence firms post solid Q4; analysts warn on valuations, order visibility
items.description: Analysts remain cautious on high valuations, uneven execution, and near-term order visibility.

items.title: BSE shares drop 5% as reports hint Sebi may approve Tuesday expiry for NSE
items.description: Shares of BSE fell sharply after reports surfaced that SEBI may approve Tuesday as the expiry day for NSE's derivatives contracts

items.title: Buy Electronics Mart India; target of Rs 151: LKP Research
items.description: LKP Research is bullish on Electronics Mart India has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 151 in its research report dated May 22, 2025.

items.title: IndusInd Bank – Is the worst over?
items.description: The MFI book is large, which can aggravate business uncertainty, and definite clues are yet to emerge about the new CEO

items.title: FIIs net sell shares worth Rs 5,045 crore; DIIs pump Rs 3,715 crore on May 22
items.description: For the year so far, FIIs have been net sellers of shares worth Rs 1.22 lakh crore, while DIIs have net bought Rs 2.41 lakh crore worth of shares.
